choices: Secretly Listen in on the Conversation.
Go to your room and hope for the best.
1.content:
You were just coming home from school that day, along the River Road when the unthinkable happened. You gasp in shock, as newsboys are rampant in the street, shouting things such as "Maginot Line Outflanked", or "Nazis rapidly approaching". You run straight to your apartment, begging that the information is false. When you walk in, however, your hopes are instantly crushed. Your family, which includes your father, Sam, your mother, Mary, and your sister, Abigail, are sitting at the dining table, with fear on their faces.
"What will we do, what will we do", your father murmurs over and over again, clenching his fists, and furrowing his brow.
"We must not give up, Sam! Remember how the Germans were defeated in the first war? We will do it again!", says your mother, hope rising up in her voice.
"There is nothing we can do. Nothing. All of our resources have been exhausted. The Germans are just unstoppable this time.", your father replies, with a dark tone in his voice.
"Kids, leave the table. We will figure this out", your mother orders you and your sister.

Do you go to your room like you were asked, or do you secretly listen in on the conversation?
1.title: Imminent German Victory

choices: As soon as possible
Next Week
11.content:
You slink back towards your room, but when you go inside, you leave the door open just a crack, so you can hear what your parents are saying. For a while, they are quiet, deep in thought. Suddenly, your father makes a noise.
"The city will be captured. There is nothing we can do about this anymore", says your father.
Your mother quickly replies,
"We may not be able to do anything now, but we can do something after the city is captured. I know a friend, whose father was in the rebellion in the first war. She says she can take us into hiding, possibly even take us out of the country. I heard that places like Switzerland and Sweden are very nice right now!"

Another few moments pass.

"Then, it is decided. We have no opportunity, we must go. Our children depend on us, we must not fail. Not for our sake, for theirs", your father finally replies.
"We shall leave..."
11.title: Secretly Listen in on the Conversation.

choices: Do you return to your room and pack
Do you spy on them again
Do you just go to sleep
111.content:
Your parents call you and your sister back to the dining room. Your mother is the one that makes the announcement to you.
"We have decided to flee the country. This is not a matter of you wanting to leave or not, we will be leaving", your mother announces to her children.
"I have made arrangements with my friend, Amelia, to take us to Switzerland. It is safe in Switzerland, and we will start a new life. We will flee the harsh rule of the Nazis", your mother exclaims.
Finally, she delivers the final bit of her mini-PSA, and says
"We will be leaving first thing in the morning tomorrow, at 6:00 sharp. Go pack your bags, and only bring what you can carry. Nothing else.Your father and I will be discussing the rest of the plans here".
111.title: As soon as possible

choices: Yes
No
1111.content:
(Quick chapter, we need fillers so this gets to the top!)

You quickly finish packing your bags, and you fall asleep after.

Does anything eventful happen during your sleep?
1111.title: Do you return to your room and pack

choices: Your family is waiting for you
You wake up to shouts and commotion
11111.content:
The hope of a restful sleep is impossible. Even when you sleep, you are haunted by the approaching Nazi menace that threatens your family, city and way of life...

You have the apocalyptic vision of a zeppelin hovering over the city, its gigantic form with an Iron Cross decorated on its side. As the crowds gather in awe and fear of the impressive, floating goliath, their cries of amusement become horror as the bombs begin to drop. It feels helpless in your dreams, watching the whole city become engulfed in flames, your family and friends perishing in the wildfire...

Panting heavily and sweating, you wake up in bed. It is time to go...
11111.title: Nightmares

choices: Take the pocketknife
Leave the pocketknife
1112.content:
Once again, you wait at your door, leaving it open just a sliver, so you can hear what your parents are discussing just a few meters away at the dining room table. Your mother is the first to speak.
"I am worried we will not make it there, I was told that it was going to be a dangerous journey", she exclaims, her voice full of worry and dread.
"No, do not worry. We will be fine. The kids will be fine, and we will make it to Switzerland alive. We can start a new life there, I know how much you have always wanted to become a shoe maker, and own your own store", your father replies.
"I suppose so", your mother replies back with a sigh.
"Now, let us go pack. We will think of things tomorrow, when we are getting ready to leave".
Your mother and father leave the table, heading to their shared room with your sister.

"Maybe I should start packing as well", you think to yourself.

Later, as you are packing, you come across a pocket knife. Do you decide to pack in the pocketknife, or leave it?
1112.title: Do you spy on them again

choices: You wake up to shouting at the door of your house.
You wake up to gunfire on your city street.
1113.content:
Feeling exhausted after the shocking things that happened today, you get ready for bed.
Soon enough, you feel the drowsiness kick in, and you slowly fade away into blackness....
1113.title: Do you just go to sleep

choices: Immediately go to sleep.
Write a letter to your friend, asking if he wishes to come with you.
112.content:
Your parents call you and your sister back to the dining room. Your mother is the one that makes the announcement to you.
"We have decided to flee the country. This is not a matter of you wanting to leave or not, we will be leaving", your mother announces to her children.
"I have made arrangements with my friend, Amelia, to take us to Switzerland. It is safe in Switzerland, and we will start a new life. We will flee the harsh rule of the Nazis", your mother exclaims.
Finally, she delivers the final bit of her mini-PSA, and says
"We will be leaving first thing in the morning next Monday, at 6:00 sharp. Until then, just remain calm, and do not tell ANYONE about our plans. Your father and I will be discussing the rest of the plans here".

You return to your room, and...
112.title: Next Week

choices: Yes
No
1121.content:
After the tiring day that was now in the past, the sheer exhaustion hits you like a rocket smashing through a wall, and you almost instantly pass out onto your bed. However, when you wake up, something doesn't seem right. The fighting which was far away last night is now ahead of your street! You quickly realize that that means the Germans have already made it past your block, and are quickly approaching the city center! You quickly get dressed and rush out to the family room, where your parents are already there in fierce discussion.
"The plan can't be carried out anymore", your mother tells you both, shaking her head.
"We must find another plan now, I will write a letter to my friend", she then exclaims, whilst walking back to her room.
"We must be ready for anything now, we don't know what is coming!", says your father, sighing directly after.
After what seems like an eternity, with the gunfire slowly making it further and further away from you, your mother finally rushes out in panic, with the letter in hand.
"We must deliver it now", says your mother, "before it is too late!" She rushes out of the room, and out of the building. Retreating back to your room, you see her carefully crossing the street, and making it to another building across the way. Soon, you see her come back again. You once again, go back to the family room. She walks into the family room, and comments,
"The plan has been made, we are to join the rebellion in France. She says they will be able to keep us safe from the Germans. We must leave at once, across the street, into her building. She says that the plans have already been made for us to cross the city with her, into a rebel hideout.".
Quickly, she rushes to your sister's room and goes to wake her up. While she is doing this, you manage to scrape together everything you could need while away into a leather bag, and strap it onto your back. Finally, after about 15 minutes, everyone is ready in the family room, and preparing to leave. Finally, she makes a quick once over of the apartment, and you make your way onto the street,
Instantly, after leaving the building, fear hits you. You think to yourself of the possibilities of possible snipers, or maybe a stray soldier that catches you. However, you quickly make it across the rough cobblestone road, and into the tall gray apartment building across from yours, where your mom's friend lives. She meets you at the entrance and quickly ushers you inside. You climb the stairs hurriedly, rushing to get to her room. Finally, as you get inside her individual apartment, she immediately starts talking with your mother, discribing multiple plans on how they should make it across the city. Finally, they decide on everything, and the plans are made. They tell you that they will be leaving tommorow, and that they will continue to talk about additional plans. Finally, she tells you that you should go to your designated 'room' in her apartment, and wait until tommorow to come out, as they have important information to talk about. You retreat to your 'room', and without anything else to do, you decide to take a nap.

Does anything interesting happen when you are asleep?
1121.title: Immediately go to sleep.

1122.content:
You think about writing a letter to your friend, but then you realize that you weren't supposed to .

What were you thinking?

End of this path, go back.
1122.title: Write a letter to your friend, asking if he wis...

choices: You wake up to shouting at the door of your house.
You wake up to gunfire on your city street.
12.content:
You leave to your room, praying that your parents will be able to figure things out. After waiting what seems like an eternity of arguments being tossed back and forth in the kitchen, you start to doze off...


Finally, you awake. It seems like it is the dead of night, but tonight is no ordinary night. You hear the rumble of the aircraft, and the sounds of artillery being fired in the distance. It seems that every single minute, every single second, the noises and explosions get closer and closer, until finally, the alarm signaling that the Germans are on the city border sounds.

*BEEEWOOOOOOOOBEEEEEEEWOOOOOOOOOOOOOO*


*BEEEEEWOOOOOOOOOOBEEEEEEEEWOOOOOOOOO*

Trembling with fear, knowing that the Nazi's are already on the outskirts of Paris, you cannot sleep.

You wait what seems like hours listening to the explosions sounding around you, and praying that the people you know and the people that you care about are not harmed in the explosion.

Finally, you fall asleep to sheer exhaustion.

When you wake up...
12.title: Go to your room and hope for the best.

choices: You get your pocket-knife, and try to subdue the German Officer
You hide in your closet, hoping that the German officer does not find you
121.content:
"OPEN UP! WE WILL USE FORCE IF WE HAVE TO", yells a German officer at the front door of your apartment, waking you up. You quickly get up, trembling in fear, that, somehow, the Nazis have already made it to your apartment building, and are currently trying to get in! However, you quickly get over the momentary shock, and start formulating a plan.

What do you do?
121.title: You wake up to shouting at the door of your house.

choices: They decide to execute you
They decide to bring you to one of the camps.
1211.content:
You think for a moment, and you instantly realize that the only possible solution, with your parents still asleep despite all of this racket, is to take your pocketknife, and attempt to subdue the German officer yourself.
You quickly make it out of your bed, and make it over to your bedside drawer, where you keep your knife. You quickly, but stealthily bring yourself to the door, and wait for it to be opened.

Suddenly, it bursts open! The German officer walked in, and you quickly jump him, taking your knife and stabbing it into his neck while he was still taking in the new environment. You watch the life seep out of his eyes, and you pull the knife out. However, just as you are reveling in your success, another German soldier walks in. He quickly realizes what you have done, and brings a gun to your head. He tells you in German,
"Drop the knife, or I shoot". You do as he tells you. Quietly, he brings you out of the house, and onto the street, without alerting your parents. Step by step, you make it across the road, and into the building currently occupied by the Germans already.

What happens?
1211.title: You get your pocket-knife, and try to subdue th...

choices: You continue with the former plan of escaping the country.
You decide to join the rebels in France, in a hope to save your family.
1212.content:
Quickly, you get up, and without thinking twice, you silently and fearfully walk towards your dresser, taking from pocketknife from it, and then quickly shuffle to your closet, hiding behind the mound of wraps that you have in there. You wait for a few minutes, but it feels like mere seconds, and then, the door blasts open with a large "thump". German soldiers walk in, shouting incomprehensible German. You do make out a few words, however, and you know that they are ordering your family out for inspection. You hear your mother crying, as the German officers roughly handle her, and then your sister, and then, finally, you hear the footsteps of your father slowly walking out the door. You want to cry out, to save them, but you know that you can't. You hide, until finally, after what seems like an eternity, the Germans exit the building. You exit the closet, trembling in fear, and start crying. You never thought something like this could happen. After a few minutes of full out crying, you finally snap back to your senses.
"Something must be done", you think to yourself, determinedly, as you think of a plan of action to get your precious family back.

What is that plan?
1212.title: You hide in your closet, hoping that the German...

choices: She is dead, slumped over on a chair.
There is a german officer holding her hostage inside.
12121.content:
Finally, after a few minutes of thinking, you decide to stay with the plan, If your parents were still here, that would be what they would want you to do. Quickly, you decide to go across the street and ask your Mom's friend about everything. Quickly, you take your fathers hunting rifle from the rack, and strap it onto your back. You wait a bit longer until the last German soldiers walk off of your block, and you quickly sprint across the cobblestone road, hoping not to be picked off by a sniper. Finally, you reach in and knock on the door. You knock once, and twice, and no one answers. You walk in.

What do you find?
12121.title: You continue with the former plan of escaping t...

choices: Go and talk to your family.
Take your gun, and try to sneak out the back door.
122.content:
"BOOM"

The sound of a massive tank smashing through the fortifications on your street, and the imminent gunfire that ensues quickly wakes you up. For a moment, you are stunned that the Germans made it all the way to the center of the city within a night, but the shock quickly washes over yourself.
"I must do something, come up with a plan, you think to yourself"
You quickly get up, and get dressed.


What is your plan?
122.title: You wake up to gunfire on your city street.

choices: We will leave now
We must stick with the plan
1221.content:
You slink out of your room, and find your family already in discussion at the dinner table.

They tell you that the plan has been made, you are to leave for Switzerland in 2 days, and that you should be packing immediately.
"Bring only the things that you can carry, or the things that you absolutely need", your mother tells you. She adds on, "We must get out of the city before the Germans take over the entire city! We will be leaving with my sister."

After this speech, you return to your room once again. However, this time, things are different. The Germans have made it in front of your block! They already have control of the block!

You start panicking, you quickly rush out of the room and tell your family that the Nazis have advanced past us already. That we can't wait any more.

Your mother finally comes up with a decision, and says....
1221.title: Go and talk to your family.

choices: Do you wake up and find yourself on a train
Do you wake up and find yourself in a building
1222.content:
As soon as you get dressed, you address the situation. You know that it is not long before the officers start searching the buildings, and when you go out into the living room, your parents and sister are nowhere to be found. Quickly, without thinking twice, you take your fathers rifle, and your swiss pocketknife, and you head out the back door, quickly sprinting away from your city street. You sprint about 10 city streets, and finally, with the sound of gunfire disappearing behind you, you slow down to a slight jog. Just as you slow down, however, a loud gunshot blasts in the distance, and a bullet whizzes by your head.
"Damn it! A Nazi sniper!", you think to yourself, as you quickly break into another sprint. The sniper is ready for your sudden movement, however, and fires another bullet. It hits you in the arm, and you feel searing pain as it penetrates and lodges itself in your arm. You stumble, then you fall. Another bullet strikes your back, and you black out.
You wake up tied together with ropes, and blindfolded. You can hear other people crying in the nearby vicinity, but you have no idea where you are.
1222.title: Take your gun, and try to sneak out the back door.

choices: You get processed, and get put into the camp
You manage to sneak out while the guards aren't looking
12221.content:
You wake up with searing pain burning throughout your body. You also noticed that you are blindfolded, but you can hear the slight rumble of a train as it passes through the mountains in France, and the heat of all the people packed in a train car. Finally, you realize the predicament you are in. You are being sent to a prison camp! You yell out in shock at this realization, and try to stand up and take your blindfold off, but the pain of the bullets is still there, and you black out again.

When you wake up, the train comes to a halt. One by one, you hear train doors opening, until finally, the train door of your car slides open.
You here an officer speaking in German to a subordinate, you only make out a few words, but you can tell that they are throwing out the dead bodies. You realize the opportunity that is at hand, and you try to stay as still as possible. As they move closer and closer to you, you start to get excited! You could be getting off here! However, as they reach you, the officer laughs, and hits you with his cane. You black out again.

When you finally wake up again, the train is at a halt once more. However, this time, you have an eery feeling that you have arrived at your final destination.
What happens next?
12221.title: Do you wake up and find yourself on a train

info.brief_description: A story of the Nazi invasion of France in World War II. Not much direct violence.
info.description:
Background information from Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_France) :
The Battle of France, also known as the Fall of France, was the German invasion of France and the Low Countries during the Second World War. In six weeks from 10 May 1940, German forces defeated Allied forces in a series of mobile operations, and conquered France, Belgium, Luxembourg and the Netherlands, bringing land operations on the Western Front to an end until 6 June 1944. Italy entered the war on 10 June 1940 and attempted an invasion of France.

The German plan for the invasion of France consisted of two main operations. In Fall Gelb (Case Yellow), German armoured units pushed through the Ardennes and then along the Somme valley to cut off and surround the Allied units that had advanced into Belgium, to meet the expected German invasion. When British, Belgian and French forces were pushed back to the sea by the mobile and well-organized German operation, the British evacuated the British Expeditionary Force (BEF) and several French divisions from Dunkirk in Operation Dynamo.

After the withdrawal of the BEF, the German forces began Fall Rot (Case Red) on 5 June. The sixty remaining French divisions made a determined resistance but were unable to overcome the German air superiority and armoured mobility. German tanks outflanked the Maginot Line and pushed deep into France. German forces occupied Paris unopposed on 14 June. This caused a chaotic period of flight for the French government and led to a collapse of the French army. German commanders met with French officials on 18 June with the goal of forcing the new French government to accept an armistice that amounted to surrender.


This story is about a young French man, aged 15, seperated from the rest of his family when the Nazi's won over Paris, and forced to join the rebellion. We will refer to him as "Pierre".

Pierre, 15, Male
~Height about 6' 2''.
~Weighs about 150 pounds
~Black, shortish Hair
~Tannish skin color.

Rules
~No killing the main character (Killing others is allowed)
~Nothing related to sex/fetishes please
~No violence that is too gory.
~No suddenly joining the opposite side or something random like turning into a unicorn.
~Please make sure that your facts are accurate, or at least not like "The leader of the Nazi's was Joseph Stalin"
~Keep adding on!!!

The story will begin on the next page.
